subject: Marketing
title: Reference Price Theory
description: A micro-lesson that makes Reference Price Theory usable.

hook.text: Nobody knows what a fair price for coffee isâ€”until they see what others charge.

buildup.text: Consumers carry internal reference prices based on past experiences and comparisons.

discovery.text: When a price falls below the reference, it feels like a deal. Above it, it feels like a rip-off.

twist.text: Starbucks raised everyone's coffee reference priceâ€”making $5 lattes feel normal.

climax.text: The brand that resets the reference price controls how the entire market is perceived.

punchline.text: Fair isn't fixed. It's whatever you anchor first.

quiz.question: What is a reference price in consumer psychology?
options: An internal benchmark based on past experience and comparisons
The lowest price available in the market
